/about.txt.name: about.txt
/about.txt.data:
Hi.
My name is Mikhail. I'm a software engineer mostly focused on developer experience, cutting-edge Web Platform features, AI and advocacy. This is my home page.
If you need something, feel free to browse around.
My entire career is here, condensed in ~30 kilobytes of this website code.

/contact/blog.name: blog
/contact/blog.description: I sometimes write but there's not much to see. More stuff anytime soon? Who knows.

/contact/email.name: email
/contact/email.description: My personal email. Please do not share it with anyone else. I will not share it with anyone else (this text was generated by Github Copilot and I love it)

/contact/github.name: github
/contact/github.description: A Github page of mine. Some of my actual paid work is open-source, so you can take a peek at that too.

/contact/twitter.name: twitter
/contact/twitter.description: Short messages on the popular platform

/experiments/README.txt.name: README.txt
/experiments/README.txt.data: A compilation of my hobby projects in software, hardware and other (sometimes silly) things

/experiments/favicon-player.name: favicon-player
/experiments/favicon-player.description: Utilizing WebCodecs API to convert & play video stream in a website favicon. I think WebCodecs API is a great addition to the web platform.

/experiments/fibonacci-indent.name: fibonacci-indent
/experiments/fibonacci-indent.description: Atom (you will never be forgotten) package that adjusts your indentation according to the Fibonacci sequence. Tabs or spaces, it doesn't matter. It's all about the numbers.

/experiments/graphql-detective.name: graphql-detective
/experiments/graphql-detective.description: A library that detects unused GraphQL queries at runtime

/experiments/misbrands.name: misbrands
/experiments/misbrands.description: A collection of slightly cursed programming stickers. Print and hand them out on the next conference! Check out the pull requests for more stickers.

/experiments/nodecg-layouts.name: nodecg-layouts
/experiments/nodecg-layouts.description: A NodeCG (broadcast graphics software) starter bundle for an easy state-to-replicant management. Words probably don't make sense, unless you come from the NodeCG world.

/experiments/pgrant.name: pgrant
/experiments/pgrant.description: A GUI wrapper for distributing promotional items in Valve Software games.

/experiments/rack-timeout.name: rack-timeout
/experiments/rack-timeout.description: A fork of Rack::Timeout that can be configured to ignore certain Rails request routes. Made for a Stack Overflow question with a bounty :)

/experiments/screamforpapers.name: screamforpapers
/experiments/screamforpapers.description: All-in-one Chromium extension to submit, track and wishlist conference CFPs

/experiments/table-debugger.name: table-debugger
/experiments/table-debugger.description: My first Arduino project is connecting Chrome Developer tools to a table. Smash it for the next breakpoint and instant stress relief.

/experiments/trow.name: trow
/experiments/trow.description: An extremely basic (just the way I like it) version of the scrum poker. Works over WebRTC.

/experiments/ttty.name: ttty
/experiments/ttty.description: A very simple pure JS lightweight terminal "emulator" that's powering this very website. I managed to squeeze the basic functionality into ~5kb (non-minified).

/talks/ai-narrator.name: ai-narrator
/talks/ai-narrator.description: I made an AI narrator for my talks during my 6-hour train to Berlin. It is supposed to have a noir movie narrator personality, but the audience usually asks to make it sarcastic. The ultimate real-time RAG demo.

/talks/frontend-tools-of-the-past-today-.name: frontend-tools-of-the-past-today-and-tomorrow
/talks/frontend-tools-of-the-past-today-.description: A big deep-dive on latest front-end tooling and infrastructure. Build tools, languages, bundlers and linters.

/talks/README.txt.name: README.txt
/talks/README.txt.data: Some of my (public) talks and presentations

/talks/reverse-engineering.name: reverse-engineering
/talks/reverse-engineering.description: A deep dive on reverse-engineering a deployed NextJS app. Uncovering marketing secrets and lies that I made up!

/talks/lets-build-everything.name: lets-build-everything
/talks/lets-build-everything.description: A (fun) lightning talk on how I build and maintain everything I do. Sacred secrets and tricks to keep the juice flowing.

/talks/watch-adblocker.name: watch-adblocker
/talks/watch-adblocker.description: A (fun) lightning talk on how I used a Javascript smartwatch to become a Jedi.
